subject: Nutrition
title: Sweat Rate and Fluid Needs
description: A quick win: understand Sweat Rate and Fluid Needs.

hook.text: Some athletes lose half a liter per hour in sweat. Others lose three liters. Variation is massive.

buildup.text: Sweat rate depends on genetics, fitness, heat adaptation, humidity, and exercise intensity.

discovery.text: Weigh yourself before and after exerciseâ€”each pound lost equals about 16 ounces of needed fluid.

twist.text: Elite marathoners finish races 2 to 3% dehydrated deliberately because carrying water slows them down.

climax.text: Personalized hydration based on measured sweat rate outperforms generic 'drink 8 glasses' advice.

punchline.text: Your sweat rate is unique. Generic advice doesn't fit.

quiz.question: How do you measure your sweat rate?
options: Weigh yourself before and after exercise
